Package ohos.agp.render

Class LinearShader

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.render.Shader
      • ohos.agp.render.LinearShader

  • public class LinearShader
extends Shader
    Represents a shader that shades colors in linear manner.

    This class inherits from Shader. You can use the methods in this class to configure the direction of the shading colors, for example, from left to right, from top to bottom, or from the upper left corner to the lower right corner.

    Since:
    3

    • Field Detail

      • points

        public Point[] points
        Indicates the coordinates of the start and end points of the shading line.

        The points array contains two elements, representing the coordinates of the start and end points of the shading line respectively. For example. If the points value is {(200,200), (400, 500)}, the shading area is defined by the enclosing rectangle of these two coordinates, and the colors will be shaded along the line from the start point to the end point.

        Since:
        3

      • stops

        public float[] stops
        Indicates the positions corresponding the shading colors in the Shader#shaderColors array.

        The positions of colors in stops increase monotonically from 0 to 1.0. When stops is null, the colors are evenly shaded.

        Since:
        3

    • Constructor Detail

      • LinearShader

        public LinearShader​()
        Default constructor used to create a LinearShader.

        Calling this constructor will automatically invoke LinearShader#LinearShader(Point[], float[], Color[], TileMode) to create a linear shader.

        Since:
        3

      • LinearShader

        public LinearShader​(Point[] newPoints,
                    float[] newStops,
                    Color[] newColors,
                    Shader.TileMode newTileMode)
        A constructor used to create a LinearShader based on the specified points, color positions, colors, and tile mode.
        Parameters:
        newPoints - Indicates the points that specify the shading line, along which the colors are shaded. The shading area is specified by the enclosing rectangle with this shading line as its diagonal.
        newStops - Indicates the positions of all colors in the shading color array.
        newColors - Indicates the array of linear shading colors.
        newTileMode - Indicates the tile mode used to shade colors when the drawn object exceeds the shading area defined by the linear shader.
        Since:
        3

    • Method Detail

      • getShaderPoints

        protected Point[] getShaderPoints​()
        Obtains the coordinates of the shading points of this LinearShader.
        Returns:
        Returns the values of LinearShader#points of the LinearShader.
        Since:
        3
